summary_points: 1. Paychex, Inc. completed a merger with Paycor HCM, Inc. on April 8, 2025, as previously announced on January 7, 2025.

2.  The filing includes the consent of Ernst & Young LLP, Paycor's independent registered public accounting firm, to the incorporation by reference of their August 22, 2024 audit report on Paycor's financials.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in this filing excerpt beyond the completed merger.
1. Jabil Inc. completed the divestiture of its Mobility Business in Q2 2024 for $2.2 billion, resulting in a pre-tax gain of $942 million (with further adjustments expected in May 2025).
2.  Jabil Inc. anticipates pre-tax restructuring costs of $150–$200 million and net cash expenditures of $100–$130 million for its 2025 Restructuring Plan, payable across fiscal years 2025 and 2026.

3. Jabil Inc. acquired Pharmaceutics International, Inc. for $307 million in cash on February 3, 2025, resulting in a significantly higher effective income tax rate of 36.2% as of February 28, 2025, compared to 12.7% in the same period of 2024.
1. Walgreens Boots Alliance is being acquired by an entity affiliated with Sycamore Partners for $11.45 per share plus a Divested Asset Proceed Right, with the deal expected to close in Q4 2025.
2. The company reported a $4.0 billion net loss for the three months ended February 28, 2025, driven largely by a $4.2 billion non-cash impairment charge.

3.  Walgreens Boots Alliance expects to spend $2.2 billion to $2.4 billion (90% cash) by the end of fiscal year 2027 on its Footprint Optimization Program, involving the closure of 1,200 to 1,300 stores.
1. Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. is withdrawing its fiscal 2025 guidance due to a pending acquisition by entities affiliated with Sycamore Partners, expected to close in Q4 2025.
2. Second quarter sales increased 4.1% year-over-year to $38.6 billion, while adjusted earnings per share decreased 47.3% on a constant currency basis to $0.63.
3. The company's free cash flow remains negative ($418 million in Q2 2025), primarily due to significant legal settlements, impacting its ability to invest in future growth initiatives.

1. CVS Health appointed Brian O. Newman as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective May 12, 2025, at an annualized base salary of $1.0 million, with a target annual equity award of $7.0 million.
2.  Thomas F. Cowhey, the outgoing CFO, will transition to Strategic Advisor to the President and Chief Executive Officer, with a departure date yet to be determined.

3. As of February 2025, CVS Health expects its full-year 2025 financial results to meet or exceed previously issued guidance; however, this projection is subject to change pending the completion of first-quarter 2025 financial closing procedures.
1. As of April 7th, 2025, News Corp had repurchased approximately US$658,086,021.22 worth of Class A and Class B shares under its US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2.  On April 7th, 2025, News Corp repurchased 21,465,169 Class A shares and 10,593,177 Class B shares.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, announced previously, intends to acquire up to $1 billion of outstanding Class A and Class B common stock, subject to market conditions and other factors.
1. On April 3, 2025, PNC Financial Services Group, Inc. appointed Mark Wiedman as President, effective April 7, 2025.

2. Wiedman's total compensation package includes a $700,000 annual base salary, a $1,000,000 signing bonus (repayable if he leaves within two years), $3,120,000 in RSUs, and $2,080,000 (at target) in PSUs.
3. Wiedman's target total annual incentive opportunity for the 2025 performance year is $9,800,000 (or $7,350,000 prorated).
1. Western Digital Corporation (WDC) completed the separation of its Flash business into an independent public company, Sandisk Corporation (SNDK), on February 21, 2025.
2.  As of Q2 2025, WDC's preliminary unaudited total assets were $25,456 million, and total liabilities were $13,110 million.
3.  WDC will report Sandisk's historical results and certain allocated assets and liabilities as discontinued operations starting in the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.
1. On April 4, 2025, Rodney Adkins announced his retirement from PayPal's Board of Directors, effective before the 2025 Annual Meeting in June, resulting in a board size reduction to 11.
2.  This 8-K filing, dated April 7, 2025, reports the departure of a director and a subsequent reduction in the size of the board.
3. There is no mention of specific future impacts or risks associated with Mr. Adkins' departure in the provided text.
